channel.title: XML.com
channel.description: XML.com features a rich mix of information and services for the XML community.

item.title: Privacy and XML, Part I
item.description: This first installment of a two-part series on privacy and XML introduces the issues at stake in online privacy and gives an overview of privacy concepts.

item.title: Perl and XML on the Command Line
item.description: In this month's Perl and XML column, Kip Hampton explores how the desperate Perl hacker can use its XML tools on the command line.

item.title: Hot and Fresh Technology for the Enterprise
item.description: This month's SVG column takes a step back from SVG's use for end-user graphics and examines its potential in the enterprise context.

item.title: Beyond W3C XML Schema
item.description: Adding XPath and XSLT into your toolchain for validating documents can give you much more control than using W3C XML Schema alone.

item.title: What's New in XSLT 2.0
item.description: A advance look at the useful and much-awaited new features in the second version of the W3C's XSLT language.

item.title: XML Namespaces 1.1
item.description: This week's Deviant examines the Namespaces 1.1 Working Draft, as well as its goals and likely impact on XML processors and development practices.

item.title: From JDOM to XmlDocument
item.description: In this second part of his "Learning C# XML" series, Niel Bornstein shows how Java-based document processing with JDOM translates into the .NET world with C#.

item.title: TAG Watch
item.description: The W3C's Technical Architecture Group (TAG), charged with making the hard decisions about the shape web technology, has now gotten down to serious business. We take a took at their progress so far.

item.title: Putting Attributes to Work
item.description: In this month's Transforming XML column, Bob DuCharme examines the treatment of source tree attributes in XSL stylesheets.

item.title: Template Languages in XSLT
item.description: Handy as it is, XSLT fails to bring a proper separation between content and presentation. This article demonstrates how XSLT can be used to implement a template language more suitable for everyday use.

item.title: SVG Tips and Tricks, Part One
item.description: In this month's SVG column Antoine Quint offers some tips and tricks for creating more useful and impressive SVG animations.

item.title: W3C XML Schema Needs You
item.description: In this week's Deviant column the issue of interoperability and specification conformance of XML Schema processors is discussed.

item.title: Basic Training
item.description: In this month's Q&A column, John Simpson attends to the most basic XML question of all: "What is XML?"

item.title: What is XSL-FO?
item.description: Extended excerpts from noted XSLT trainer Ken Holman's book on the W3C's XSL Formatting Objects specification.

item.title: What's New in XPath 2.0
item.description: XPath's about to become a lot more powerful and flexible. Evan Lenz guides us through a tour of the new features of XPath 2.0.
